problem.question: A test statistic is best defined as:

choices.choice: the difference between the critical value and the hypothesized value
the difference between a point estimate of a population parameter and its hypothesized value
an estimate of the value of the parameter in question based on a sample
the value or values that define the regions for rejecting or failing to reject the null hypothesis

problem.question: Adam Farman has been asked to estimate the volatility of a technology stock index. choices.choice: being greatest at the option's expiration date
being typically greater than the option's intrinsic value
the entire premium for an out-of-the-money option
the amount by which the intrinsic value exceeds the option premium

problem.question: The price value of a basis point (PVBP) for a bond is most accurately described as:

the change in the price of the bond when its yield changes by 0.01 %
the change in the price of the bond when its duration changes by one basis point
an estimate of the curvature of the price-yield relationship for a small change in yield

choices.choice: ordinal scale. Questions 33 through 44 relate to Economics. (18 minutes)

problem.question: The short run, as an economic decision-making time frame, is best described as:

choices.choice: one year or the length of the firm& #8217;s production cycle
the period during which the firm& #8217;s plant size and production methods are fixed
the period in which the firm cannot change its input quantities of labor and materials

problem.question: After working in a grocery store for two years, earning $20,000 per year, Mike Hoffman joined a professional sports team. choices.choice: the inflation rate for a given period of time
an unbiased estimate of changes in the cost of living
a weighted average cost for a basket of goods and services

problem.question: A risk averse investor is best described as an individual who:

choices.choice: will choose a relatively low-risk portfolio
prefers investments with less risk to those with more risk if they have the same expected return

problem.question: Inflation risk in bond investing is best described as the risk that the:

choices.choice: value of a bond& #8217;s payments will decline in terms of real goods and services
realized yield will be less than the bond& #8217;s yield to maturity as of the purchase date
price of a bond will respond more to an increase in interest rates than to an equal-sized decrease in interest rates. Questions 111 through 116 relate to Derivatives. (9 minutes)

problem.question: The role of financial statement analysis is best described as:

choices.choice: a common requirement for companies that are listed on public exchanges
the reports and presentations a company uses to show its financial performance to investors, creditors, and other interested parties
the use of information from a company& #8217;s financial statements along with other information to make economic decisions regarding that company

problem.question: The effects that the acceptance of a project may have on other firm cash flows are best described as:

receives extra dividends if the firm& #8217;s profits are greater than a predetermined level

A discrete random variable is best described as a variable that can be assigned a(n):

choices.choice: finite number of possible integer values
infinite number of possible integer values

choices.choice: fail and their historical returns are removed from the database
elect to report results to a database and their historical returns are added to the database
have the option of reporting results, leading to over-representation of better-performing hedge funds

problem.question: Tracking error is most accurately described as the difference between:

choices.choice: a sample mean and the mean of the distribution
a moving average of closing prices and the most recent closing price

choices.choice: have high returns correlations with other asset classes
approximate the investor& #8217;s total investable universe as a group

problem.question: A dark pool is best described as:

choices.choice: an exchange with low trading volume

an alternative trading system that does not reveal current orders

Jasmir Singh, CFA, is discussing unemployment and makes the following statements: & #8226; Frictional unemployment describes unemployment resulting from economic cycles. When the economy goes into a recession, frictional unemployment increases. & #8226; Structural unemployment results from a mismatch between workers& #8217; skills and the jobs available as economic changes eliminate some jobs and create new ones. Has Singh accurately described these two types of unemployment?

choices.choice: Both of these statements are accurate
Neither of these statements is accurate
Only one of these statements is accurate
